topic_title: communicate in formal and informal situations.
can_do_statement: I can communicate in formal and informal situations.

lessons.title: Formal Greetings and Introductions
lessons.objective: Learn formal greetings and introductions appropriate for professional settings or interactions with elders.

cards.grammar_explanation: Used in the morning, typically until noon.

cards.example_sentence: Buenas tardes, profesora Rodríguez. ¿Cómo le va?
Buenas noches, señora González. Que descanse.

cards.grammar_explanation: Titles used with surnames in formal settings.
A formal way to offer assistance.

lessons.title: Informal Greetings and Introductions
lessons.objective: Learn informal greetings and introductions appropriate for friends, family, or casual acquaintances.

cards.grammar_explanation: Very informal, often used among friends.
Informal way to ask how someone is doing.

lessons.title: Making Formal Requests and Asking for Favors
lessons.objective: Learn polite and formal ways to make requests and ask for favors.

cards.grammar_explanation: A polite way to make a request.

cards.back: Would you be so kind as to...?
cards.example_sentence: ¿Sería tan amable de pasarme la sal?
cards.grammar_explanation: A very polite and formal request.

cards.back: I would be very grateful if...
cards.example_sentence: Le agradecería mucho si pudiera revisar este documento.
Disculpe, ¿tendría un bolígrafo que me preste?
cards.grammar_explanation: Politely asking if someone has something.

cards.back: I would like to ask you a favor
cards.example_sentence: Quisiera pedirle un favor, si no es mucha molestia.
Tengo una consulta sobre el contrato.
cards.grammar_explanation: Introducing a formal question or inquiry.

cards.example_sentence: Gracias de antemano por su ayuda.

lessons.title: Making Informal Requests and Asking for Favors
lessons.objective: Learn casual and informal ways to make requests and ask for favors from friends or family.

cards.grammar_explanation: Informal way to ask for help.

cards.back: Can you give me a hand?
cards.example_sentence: ¿Puedes echarme una mano con la mudanza?

cards.grammar_explanation: Informal way to ask if someone has something.
Informal way to ask if someone is capable of something.

cards.example_sentence: Hazme el paro y cómprame unas cervezas.
cards.grammar_explanation: Mexican slang for asking a favor.

lessons.title: Expressing Formal Disagreements and Objections
lessons.objective: Learn how to express disagreements or objections politely and formally.

cards.example_sentence: Respetuosamente, no estoy de acuerdo con su propuesta.
cards.grammar_explanation: A polite and formal way to disagree.

cards.back: I take the liberty of disagreeing
cards.example_sentence: Me permito disentir con respecto a ese punto.
cards.grammar_explanation: A very formal expression of disagreement.

cards.example_sentence: Con el debido respeto, creo que está equivocado.

cards.front: Comprendo su punto de vista, pero...
cards.back: I understand your point of view, but...
cards.ipa: komˈpɾen.do su ˈpun.to de ˈβis.ta ˈpe.ɾo
cards.example_sentence: Comprendo su punto de vista, pero tengo una opinión diferente.
Lamento discrepar, pero no creo que sea la mejor solución.
cards.grammar_explanation: A formal expression of regret before disagreeing.

cards.example_sentence: No comparto su opinión sobre este tema.
cards.grammar_explanation: A direct but polite way to disagree.

cards.front: Quizás haya otra manera de verlo
cards.back: Perhaps there is another way to see it
cards.ipa: kiˈθas ˈaʝa ˈo.tɾa maˈne.ɾa de ˈβeɾ.lo
cards.example_sentence: Quizás haya otra manera de verlo para llegar a un acuerdo.
Sin embargo, hay otros factores a considerar.

lessons.title: Expressing Informal Disagreements and Objections
lessons.objective: Learn how to express disagreements or objections in a casual and informal way.

cards.front: No estoy de acuerdo, la verdad
cards.back: I don't agree, to be honest
cards.ipa: no esˈtoi̯ de aˈkweɾ.ðo la βeɾˈdad
cards.example_sentence: No estoy de acuerdo, la verdad, me parece una mala idea.

cards.back: I don't see it that way
cards.example_sentence: Yo no lo veo así, creo que estás exagerando.
¿En serio? No creo que sea cierto.

cards.back: It doesn't seem right to me
cards.grammar_explanation: Expressing that something doesn't seem fair or correct.

cards.example_sentence: - Dice que va a nevar hoy. - ¡Qué va! No lo creo.
cards.grammar_explanation: Expressing strong disagreement or disbelief. Spain

cards.example_sentence: Ni hablar, no voy a hacer eso.

cards.grammar_explanation: Mexican slang expressing disbelief or surprise.
